definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to complete a contract/to reach a deal
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to submit (a report etc)/to refer (a problem) to sb
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
Ministry of Foreign Affairs/foreign office/Dept. of State
to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish

sentences.english: Have you remained silent in an English conversation because you were afraid of saying something wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你是否因爲擔心自己會講錯英文而在交流時保持沉默？

sentences.english: Few friends has she made since she came into this school last year.
sentences.chinese: 自從去年她來到這個學校，沒交幾個朋友。

sentences.english: A $100 registration fee per team is required.
sentences.chinese: 每隊必須交100美元的報名費。

sentences.english: Sex one-inch colour photos of the students are needed.
sentences.chinese: 需辦理接送卡的學生交家長一寸相片2張。

sentences.english: He handed the purse t0 the teacher.
Where do we submit the tender?
A local tough guy befriended me.
sentences.chinese: 當地的惡漢和我交了朋友。

sentences.english: He handed it out without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 他不假思索的把它交了上去。

sentences.english: Hello, I came to pay my phone bill.
And so he gives a tithe for the war.
sentences.chinese: 所以他給交了戰爭的什一稅。

sentences.english: She boarded at twenty US dollars a week.
Why didn't you hand in your homework last time?
sentences.chinese: 你上次爲什麼沒交家庭作業。

sentences.english: Before delivering the job, run the spelling and grammar checker once more, just for safety's sake.
sentences.chinese: 在交活兒以前，僅爲保險起見，須再運行一次拼寫。

sentences.english: Blagojevich is freed on his own recognizance.
sentences.chinese: 在交了保證金後被釋放。

sentences.english: Every time I go to pay calls always line up, never less than automatic payment machine.
sentences.chinese: 每次去交話費總是排隊，從來不到自動交款機。

sentences.english: When the clock hand reached and collects the magnets - the assignments are due.
sentences.chinese: 當時鍾指針到達並收集了這些磁鐵，就該交作業了。

definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to hand over to/to give to higher authority/to seek connections in high places
to pay up/to shell out/to hand over the money to cover sth
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
